These programs include instruction in surgical procedures, current monitoring procedures, fluid therapy, pain management, diagnostic and therapeutic procedures outside the operating room, and operating room safety.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the application of dental care procedures to the teeth, eating surfaces, and oral cavities of animals. These programs include instruction in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases and abnormalities of animal teeth and gums and related parts of the oral cavity; and related anatomical and physiological principles.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the delivery of specialized care to animals with diseases of the skin, scales, feathers, hair, nails and mucous membranes. These programs include instruction in dermatologic surgical procedures, cutaneous allergies, and diagnostic and therapeutic techniques.

Class title: Veterinary emergency and critical care medicine residency programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the emergency treatment and management of care for animals with acutely life-threatening conditions which may include multiple organ failure. These programs include instruction in the management of critical care units, emergency procedures, and long-term care of critically diseased animals.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the provision of general medical services to animals with a wide range of non-surgical clinical problems. These programs include instruction in behavioural aspects of diseases, animal diagnosis, animal aging, and referral procedures.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the principles and practices of applied veterinary research and related techniques, equipment, data systems and research design. These programs include instruction in the management of veterinary and other animal research laboratories and health care facilities.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in clinical applications of research on harmful microorganisms, including viruses, and of the disease processes they induce in animals.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians to apply research on the chemical nature of food substances; the processes by which animals ingest, digest, absorb, transport, utilize and excrete food and nutrients; and their relation to animal behaviour and health.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of ophthalmic diseases and disorders in animals, and related ocular pathology procedures. These programs include instruction in animal eye surgery.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the clinical laboratory analysis and diagnosis of diseased animal tissues and anatomic abnormalities. These programs include instruction in performing general autopsies, forensic medicine, laboratory management and quality control.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the provision of regular and long-term care to animals, health services to owners, and the management of independent veterinary practices. These programs include instruction in comprehensive care and specialist referral, basic surgery, emergency medical procedures, and diagnostic imaging.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the investigation of and intervention in health and disease problems of animal and related human communities; comparative medicine; and animal public health. These programs include instruction in biostatistics, epidemiology, environmental control, toxicology and the planning and administration of animal health programs and services.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the use of radiologic imaging and therapies to diagnose and treat animal diseases and health problems. These programs include instruction in the use and handling of equipment for radionuclides detection and application.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the care and treatment of animal diseases and disorders via invasive procedures and the etiology, pathogenesis, diagnosis and management of physical disorders. These programs include instruction in clinical and operative skills, pre-operative and postoperative care, trauma management, endoscopic techniques, and applications to large and small animal medicine.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of diseases and health problems affecting the reproductive systems of animals, and the comprehensive care and treatment of parent animals, animal fetuses and newborn or newly hatched animals throughout the gestation period.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the clinical application of research on the nature and extent of adverse effects of synthetic and naturally occurring chemical substances on animals. These programs include instruction in chemical mechanisms and the specialties of reproductive, developmental, genetic, forensic, inhalation and neurobehavioural toxicology.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians in the specialized treatment and care of zoo animals, performing animals, and animals living in the wild. These programs include instruction in the principles and procedures used in the observation, diagnosis, care and treatment of illness, disease, injury, deformity, or other anomalies in non-domesticated animals.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians to work in the commercial poultry industry, providing services and technical support pertaining to prevention, diagnosis, and management of disease; epidemiology; genetics; and nutrition.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians to understand and treat the behavioural problems of animals, primarily through the application of behaviour modification techniques to companion animals; may also involve diagnosis of medical conditions that can affect a pet's behaviour, and the use of medication in conjunction with behaviour modification therapy.

This instructional program class comprises any residency training program that prepares veterinarians to apply advanced knowledge of the chemical properties and biological effects of drugs to rational drug therapy in animal patients. These programs include instruction in the comparative pharmacology of principal drug groups, pharmacokinetics, basic mechanisms and features of diseases occurring in domesticated animals, the role of drugs in modifying the disease process, and specific skills critical to the practice of clinical pharmacology.
This instructional program class comprises any program not listed above that relates to Veterinary residency/fellowship programs.
This subseries comprises instructional program classes 60.0701 to 60.0799.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in nursing.

This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in two or more nursing specialties.

Class title: Acute care nurse practitioner residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in acute care medicine.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in adult/gerontology acute care medicine.

This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in gerontology.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in global health.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in hospice and palliative medicine.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in hospital medicine.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed nurse practitioners that provides advanced didactic and clinical training in infectious diseases.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in acute care medicine.

Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in acute care surgery.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in cardiology.

Class title: Cardiothoracic surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in cardiothoracic surgery.

Class title: Critical care physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in critical care medicine.

Class title: Critical care and trauma surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in critical care and trauma surgery.

Class title: Emergency medicine physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in emergency medicine.

Class title: ENT surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in ENT (ears, nose, and throat) surgery.

Class title: Family medicine physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in family medicine.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in geriatrics.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in hematology and oncology.

Class title: Hepatobiliary surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in hepatobiliary surgery.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in hospital medicine.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in neurosurgery.

Class title: Orthopedic surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in orthopedic surgery.

Class title: Pediatric surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in pediatric surgery.

Class title: Transplant surgery physician assistant residency/fellowship programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in transplant surgery.
This instructional program class comprises any residency or fellowship program for licensed physician assistants/associates that provides advanced training in urology.
This instructional program class comprises any program not listed above that relates to Physician assistant/associate residency/fellowship programs.
This subseries comprises instructional program class 60.9999.
This instructional program class comprises any program not listed above that relates to Health professions residency/fellowship programs.

This series comprises residency and fellowship programs that prepare physicians (MD), osteopathic physicians (DO), and podiatrists (DPM) for certification as practitioners of recognized medical specialties. These programs are approved and accredited by designated professional associations and require from one to seven years to complete, depending on the program. Residency or fellowship programs that also result in the completion of an academic degree (e.g., MS, MSc, PhD), should be reported under one of the clinical sciences codes located in Series 26. Biological and biomedical sciences or in subseries 51.14 Medical clinical sciences/graduate medical studies, rather than in a residency code located in Series 61.
This subseries comprises instructional program classes 61.0101 to 61.0199.

This instructional program class comprises any combined educational program in two or more closely related medical specialty or subspecialty programs which has been approved by the specialty board of each of the specialties to ensure that resident physicians completing combined training are eligible for board certification in each of the component specialties. The duration of combined training is longer than any one of its component specialty programs standing alone, and shorter than all of its component specialty programs together.

Class title: Diagnostic radiology/nuclear medicine combined specialty programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any combined educational program in diagnostic radiology and nuclear medicine which has been approved by the specialty board of each of the specialties to ensure that resident physicians completing combined training are eligible for board certification in each of the component specialties. The duration of combined training is longer than any one of its component specialty programs standing alone, and shorter than all of its component specialty programs together.

This instructional program class comprises any combined educational program in emergency medicine and anesthesiology which has been approved by the specialty board of each of the specialties to ensure that resident physicians completing combined training are eligible for board certification in each of the component specialties. The duration of combined training is longer than any one of its component specialty programs standing alone, and shorter than all of its component specialty programs together.

Class title: Family medicine/emergency medicine combined specialty programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any combined educational program in family medicine and emergency medicine which has been approved by the specialty board of each of the specialties to ensure that resident physicians completing combined training are eligible for board certification in each of the component specialties. The duration of combined training is longer than any one of its component specialty programs standing alone, and shorter than all of its component specialty programs together.

Class title: Family medicine/osteopathic neuromusculoskeletal medicine combined specialty programs
Class definition: This instructional program class comprises any combined educational program in family medicine and osteopathic neuromusculoskeletal medicine which has been approved by the specialty board of each of the specialties to ensure that resident physicians completing combined training are eligible for board certification in each of the component specialties. The duration of combined training is longer than any one of its component specialty programs standing alone, and shorter than all of its component specialty programs together.
